intro: Doria incisa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed doria, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Doria incisa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
